title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Chemical Pathology
description: To attend seminars/workshops and carry out assignments for the purposes of increasing knowledge of the research area and improving experimental design and data analysis.
outcome: - To acquire the ability to formulate relevant research questions. - To perform a comprehensive literature review & identify and access bibliographical resources, databases and other sources of relevant information. - To cultivate critical thinking and learning skill. - To acquire the communication and writing skill.
syllabus: Supervisors would provide guidance to students on research project and thesis writing. Students would gain deeper understanding of a subject area and develop analytical, problem solving and research skills.

title: Guided Studies
requirements: For students in MPhil Chemical Pathology

outcome: - To acquire the ability to formulate relevant research questions. - To perform a comprehensive literature review & identify and access bibliographical resources, databases and other sources of relevant information. - To cultivate critical thinking and learning skill. - To acquire the communication and writing skill.
syllabus: Supervisors would provide guidance to students on research project and thesis writing. Students would gain deeper understanding of a subject area and develop analytical, problem solving and research skills.

title: Seminar
requirements: For students in MPhil Chemical Pathology
description: To present a seminar summarizing research work performed in the previous term/year.
outcome: - To enhance presentation skill. - To enhance communication skill & engagement in meaningful and critical scientific discussion.
syllabus: Supervisors and students would participate in departmental seminars on a weekly basis to update knowledge in different research areas. Students would give at least one presentation at departmental seminars in the whole normative study period.

title: Research
requirements: For students in MPhil Chemical Pathology
description: To conduct laboratory-based research work on the assigned research topic.
outcome: - To acquire the ability to formulate and tackle relevant research questions. - To cultivate critical thinking and data analysis skill. - To acquire and consolidate experimental and analytical skill. - To acquire the ability to derive appropriate study conclusion. - To acquire the ability to work as a team.
syllabus: The course covers study design, research methods and statistical interpretation. Supervisors would provide guidance to students on research project.
